fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article about Sir John Sulston described James Watson as “one of the discoverers of DNA”. Rather, Watson and Francis Crick are credited with discovering the structure of DNA in 1953, its existence having been isolated more than 80 years earlier (British geneticist and Nobel laureate Sulston dies at 75, 10 March, page 2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Civil rights pioneer Viola Desmond is first Canadian woman on currency The week in wildlife - in pictures
